docs.lead_paragraph: ARRIVAL OF THE EMPIRE CITY--NEW POSTAL ARRANGEMENTS AT HAVANA--STATE OF THE MARKETS AND OF PUBLIC HEALTH--WRECK OF A BRITISH MAIL STEAMER REPORTED. The steamer Empire City, Capt. S. P. GRIFFITH, arrived here last evening, having left new-Orleans July 20, arrived at Havana on the 22d, at 6 P. M., and left for this port at 9:30 A. M. the next day, 234.

docs.lead_paragraph: BOARD OF HEALTH.--A meeting of the Board was held yesterday morning. Complaints were made against vacant lots northwest corner of Harrison and Court streets and low lots on block bounded by Hamilton-avenue, Mill and Court-street, and 75 feet on Hamilton avenue.

headline.main: " Awful" Gardner's Narrative of his Experiences.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Newark Mercury, 26th. Concert Hall was filled last evening to overflowing. Every available place where there was to ?? to stand or sit was occupied, and hundreds went a way unable to obtain admittance. Long before the doors were opened a large crowd had collected, and were the hall was thrown open it was speedily filled.

docs.snippet: There are few who have heard of St. Catherine's, although in the little town which bears that name is one of the most remarkable medicinal springs on the continent, or indeed in the world; for, with the exception of a single spa in Germany, there is...

headline.main: LETTERS FROM SUMMER LOUNGERS.; The St. Catherine's Springs in Canada West.

docs.lead_paragraph: There are few who have heard of St. Catherine's, although in the little town which bears that name is one of the most remarkable medicinal springs on the continent, or indeed in the world; for, with the exception of a single spa in Germany, there is no known water of such powerful efficacy as that which gushes from the artesian well at this place.

docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times: About a year ago a young German couple arrived here from Leipsic, Saxony; they were married in "the Old Country" by one of the American Consuls. The young wife left everything dear to her--a loving family and...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: About a year ago a young German couple arrived here from Leipsic, Saxony; they were married in "the Old Country" by one of the American Consuls. The young wife left everything dear to her--a loving family and numerous friends--to follow her husband to a strange land, hoping that he would reward her love with kindness and affection. She found herself deceived.

headline.main: THE OFFAL AND PIGGERY NUISANCES.; Hog-Town Invaded by Eighty-seven Armed Men. Pig-pens Demolished, Offal-boiling appurtenances Removed and one Boll-dog Shet--The Excitement the Luci?? and the Episodes. The war declared by the Commissioners of Health Against by the proprietors of the piggeries and offal boiling establishments, up-town, commenced. Their Forcible Abatement by Order of the City Inspector.

docs.lead_paragraph: The war declared by the Commissioners of Health against the proprietors of the piggeries and offal boiling establishments, up-town, commenced yesterday in earnest. All the diplomacy of certain Police Justices, Aldermen and other neutral powers, for the adjustment of the difficulties of the belligerents had failed, and the army of the City Inspector established its head-quarters at 8 A. M. at WALDEMYER'S drove yard, corner of Fifty-fourth-street and Fifth-avenue.

docs.snippet: Tile R. M. steamship Europa fron Liverpool on the 16th inst., with three days later European advices, arrived at Halifax at 1 o'clock, P. M., yesterday, but we are unable, in consequence of the continued misunderstanding of the Agent of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Tile R. M. steamship Europa fron Liverpool on the 16th inst., with three days later European advices, arrived at Halifax at 1 o'clock, P. M., yesterday, but we are unable, in consequence of the continued misunderstanding of the Agent of the Associated Press with the Nova Scotia line of telegraph, to give the news this morning.

docs.snippet: During the month of August State Elections will be held in Kentucky, Tennessee, Alabama, North Carolina, Arkansas, and Texas. Full State tickets are to be elected in all these States. The contest is peculiarly animated in Kentucky and Tennessee, in...
docs.lead_paragraph: During the month of August State Elections will be held in Kentucky, Tennessee, Alabama, North Carolina, Arkansas, and Texas. Full State tickets are to be elected in all these States. The contest is peculiarly animated in Kentucky and Tennessee, in each of which the opposing candidates have been actively engaged for some weeks past in a personal canvass.
